dialogue:
Speaker: I just found out I got the scholarship I applied for! I've been working so hard for this.
Response: That's amazing news! You must be so proud of yourself. All that hard work really paid off!

Speaker: My dog passed away yesterday. We had her for 14 years.
Response: I'm so sorry for your loss. Losing a pet is incredibly hard - they really become part of the family.

Speaker: I have a big presentation tomorrow and I can't stop worrying about it.
Response: That sounds stressful. What part of it are you most worried about?

Speaker: I just got back from visiting my childhood home. So many memories came flooding back.
Response: Cool. So what else is new?

Speaker: My coworker took credit for my project in front of the whole team.
Response: That's really frustrating and unfair. Have you had a chance to talk to your manager about it?

Speaker: I'm the only one of my friends who didn't get invited to the party.
Response: That must feel really hurtful to be left out like that. I'm sorry you're going through this.

Speaker: I tripped and fell in front of everyone at the company meeting today.
Response: Oh no, that sounds embarrassing! Are you okay though? Everyone trips sometimes.

Speaker: I'm really nervous about my first day at the new job tomorrow.
Response: Don't worry about it. You'll be fine.

Speaker: My sister just had a baby! I'm an aunt for the first time!
Response: Congratulations! That's so exciting! Do you have any pictures?

Speaker: I studied all week for this exam and still failed.
Response: That's so disappointing, especially after all that effort. What do you think went wrong?
